TO: NAEB E. D. COMMITTEE
FROM s Frank Schooley
1. Heport from John Ivy, Southern Regional Education Boards
(Telephone 6781, Atlanta, Georgia;,:
Worked with Earl about 18 months. Ivy on research, Earl
in Communications, on naval research project in mass com¬
munications, Has known him less intimately over a longer
period of years. On administration ability, Wynn has
vigor and imagination...he works well with groups; worked
j well with research people...has flexibility...makes a
'v fine impression on lay groups..."all In all, I8d rate him
"A."...while not In close contact with staff. Ivy impression
was that Wynn always had a "devoted and excited team work-
ing for him." Again, Ivy said he thought he would rate
Wynn with an "A." He thought Gordon Blackwell would offer
some light regarding more recent dates, because Ivy hasn*t
been at North Carolina for about four years.
2. Report from Professor Gordon Blackwell, University of North
Carolina. "I have no reservations in any respect regard¬
ing Earl....I think the TV program Is going through here,
and I think it would be disastrous for us to lose him....
Earl stands very high....has done an awfully good job de¬
veloping the Communications Center from scratch....fine
esprit de oorps among staff members....I believe Earl is
developing, and is even better than when John Ivy worked
with him....Earl stands tops....repeat: I have no reser¬
vations in any respect regarding Earl."
3, Above remarks are accurate references, some direct quotes;
others indirect, but mostly direct paraphrase if not
exact words.
Have also written the following and probably will supply
special Washington meeting with dope on or before day
of meeting: Dr. Frank P. Graham, Governor Kerr Scott,
Chancellor Robert Burton House.
10-10*52 '
